metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5461 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow in the vararg functions in ldo.c in Lua 5.1 through 5.2.xbefore 5.2.3 allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial ofservice (crash) via a small number of arguments to a function with a largenumber of fixed arguments.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5461` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblua5.2-0 - 5.2.3-1
lua5.2 - 5.2.3-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

liblua5.1-0 - 5.1.5-5ubuntu0.1
lua5.1 - 5.1.5-5ubuntu0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

liblua50 - 5.0.3-7
liblualib50 - 5.0.3-7
lua50 - 5.0.3-7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: lua5.2 package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.2.3-1').
lua5.1 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.1.5-5ubuntu0.1').
lua50 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.0.3-7').
